text: Erigeron velutipes is a North American species of flowering plant in the daisy family known by the common names delicate fleabane and Chihuahuan fleabane. It is native to northern and southwestern Mexico, including in the states of Sonora, Nayarit, Michoacán, and Jalisco)Tropicos, specimen listings for Erigeron velutipes Hook. & Arn. and just over the United States border into Santa Cruz County, Arizona.Biota of North America Program 2014 county distribution map Erigeron velutipes grows in moist locations near springs. It is an annual herb up to 20 centimeters (8 inches) tall, producing a taproot. The inflorescence is made up of 1-3 flower heads per stem. Each head contains 50–75; white or blue ray florets surrounding numerous yellow disc florets.Flora of North America, Erigeron velutipes Hooker & Arnott, 1841.
